SENT.plain: Primary antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) is a disease producing vascular thrombus with antiphospholipid antibody without association with autoimmune diseases as systemic lupus erythematosus
Retinal vein occlusion is a rare vascular manifestation in primary APS
We describe 2 cases of primary APS presenting with developing blurred vision
Each had central retinal vein occlusion and high titer of IgG anticardiolipin antibody
